channel.title: Possible java driveby?
channel.description:
do not go to this link: http://google.com/index2.html Well I suspect this is a java driveby, how do I check this?
Edited to remove the shameful "edited by Tom_BETA"

item.title: Possible java driveby?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

it runs an applet and jp2launcher + Java .exe start running.

OP/others refer to + common sense:

[quote=“Tom_BETA, post:6, topic:424748”]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drive-by_download

PS saphire it may be a Java drive by, jp2launcher is triggered when you visit the page, not looked yet am doing now.

So, you ask how does one know if something is infected? Fairly easy. First of all always check the source code before you run any applets or visit any pages, the most stupid people will always have something like:

On the other hand people can integrate viruses within JAR files which you download (typically found in webclients) and when executed can run a Java code to download the virus then, this is sneaky but still easily detectable by running a check on the I/O connections.

You can also use the 999 available website/file scanners like:

avg-2683519.hs-sites.com

How to check if a website is safe

Website safety checks are a critical part of keeping your information safe online, but how can you tell if a website is safe? Just follow these tips.

I’ll update my post will full information on what the website is about, then I’ll probably censor it to stop people clicking it.[/quote]

Pretty sure it’s some form of DB so I’ll just censor it in a second, if you think otherwise please PM me!

Read full topic

item.title: Possible java driveby?
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

I’ll look into it more, I’ll let you know if your keeping this topic open for a bit longer.

I’ll have too deactivate my anti virus though, stops me from visiting the website that’s why I didn’t do a in depth study on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Possible java driveby?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Drive-by download

Drive-by download means two things, each concerning the unintended download of computer software from the Internet: Drive-by downloads may happen when visiting a website, viewing an e-mail message or by clicking on a deceptive pop-up window: by clicking on the window in the mistaken belief that, for example, an error report from the computer's operating system itself is being acknowledged or a seemingly innocuous advertisement pop-up is being dismissed. In such cases, the "supplier" may claim tha...

PS saphire it may be a Java drive by, jp2launcher is triggered when you visit the page, not looked yet am doing now.

So, you ask how does one know if something is infected? Fairly easy. First of all always check the source code before you run any applets or visit any pages, the most stupid people will always have something like:

On the other hand people can integrate viruses within JAR files which you download (typically found in webclients) and when executed can run a Java code to download the virus then, this is sneaky but still easily detectable by running a check on the I/O connections.

You can also use the 999 available website/file scanners like:

avg-2683519.hs-sites.com

How to check if a website is safe

Website safety checks are a critical part of keeping your information safe online, but how can you tell if a website is safe? Just follow these tips.

I’ll update my post will full information on what the website is about, then I’ll probably censor it to stop people clicking it.

Read full topic

item.title: Possible java driveby?
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

[quote=“lol k, post:3, topic:424748”][quote author=Saphire` link=topic=527409.msg3844516#msg3844516 date=1323523553]
infection: vbs:Agent-DZ [Trj]

The site just attempts to download an infected file to your computer, I don’t think it’s a Java driveby though because there is no applet, probably a basic trojan.
[/quote]
It is a driveby…[/quote]
It’s not, it’s a trojan. Look at the quote I posted the code tags are [Trj].

Read full topic
